metadata.Title: CVE-2012-3462 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in SSSD version 1.9.0. The SSSD's access-provider logic causes the result of the HBAC rule processing to be ignored in the event that the access-provider is also handling the setup of the user's SELinux user context.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3462` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libipa-hbac0 - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
libnss-sss - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
libpam-sss - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
libsss-certmap0 - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
libsss-idmap0 - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
libsss-nss-idmap0 - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
libsss-simpleifp0 - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
libsss-sudo - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
libwbclient-sssd - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
python-libipa-hbac - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
python-libsss-nss-idmap - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
python-sss - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
python3-libipa-hbac - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
python3-libsss-nss-idmap - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
python3-sss - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
sssd - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
sssd-ad - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
sssd-ad-common - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
sssd-common - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
sssd-dbus - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
sssd-ipa - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
sssd-kcm - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
sssd-krb5 - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
sssd-krb5-common - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
sssd-ldap - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
sssd-proxy - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
sssd-tools - 1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sssd package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.16.1-1ubuntu1.4').
